meditation.title: Basic Loving-Kindness Meditation (Metta Bhavana)
meditation.description: A foundational practice for developing unconditional loving-kindness towards all beings, beginning with oneself and gradually extending to others.

preparation: Find a comfortable seated position with your back straight
Close your eyes gently or soften your gaze downward
Take three deep breaths to settle into the present moment
Bring to mind the intention to cultivate loving-kindness

stages.title: Loving-kindness towards yourself
stages.description: Begin by directing loving-kindness towards yourself
phrases: May I be free from suffering
stages.guidance: Visualize yourself surrounded by warm, golden light. Feel genuine care and kindness for yourself as you would for a dear friend.

stages.title: Loving-kindness towards a loved one
stages.description: Bring to mind someone you love easily - family, friend, or teacher
phrases: May you be free from suffering
stages.guidance: Visualize this person clearly and direct the same warm wishes towards them. Feel the natural love flowing from your heart.

stages.title: Loving-kindness towards a neutral person
stages.description: Think of someone neutral - a neighbor, shopkeeper, or acquaintance
phrases: May you be free from suffering
stages.guidance: This person is neither friend nor enemy. Practice extending the same genuine care towards them as you did for your loved one.

stages.title: Loving-kindness towards a difficult person
stages.description: Gently bring to mind someone with whom you have difficulties
phrases: May you be free from suffering
stages.guidance: Start with someone mildly difficult, not your greatest enemy. Remember that their happiness contributes to less suffering in the world.

stages.title: Loving-kindness towards all beings
stages.description: Extend loving-kindness to all beings everywhere
phrases: May all beings be free from suffering
May all beings live with ease
stages.guidance: Visualize loving-kindness radiating outward from your heart to all corners of the universe, embracing all living beings.

closing: Rest in the feeling of loving-kindness for a few moments
Notice any warmth or openness in your heart
Dedicate the merit of this practice to the benefit of all beings
Gently open your eyes and carry this loving awareness into your day

benefits: Increases feelings of connection and empathy
Prepares the mind for deeper meditation practices

scriptural_references.translation: This is what should be done by one who is skilled in goodness, and who knows the path of peace

variations.name: Extended Practice
variations.description: Spend more time on each stage, adding specific groups like family, community, country, world

variations.name: Walking Metta
variations.description: Practice loving-kindness while walking slowly, sending metta to all beings you encounter

variations.name: Metta for Specific Qualities
variations.description: Focus on specific aspects like 'May you be free from fear', 'May you be confident', etc.

integration_practices: Send loving-kindness to people you encounter throughout the day
When feeling angry or frustrated, return to metta phrases
Practice metta before difficult conversations or meetings
Use metta as a way to fall asleep peacefully
Include metta in daily prayer or reflection time

cultural_context.tradition: This practice originates from the Buddha's teachings and is central to Theravada Buddhism
cultural_context.brahma_vihara: One of the four Brahma-viharas (divine abodes): metta, karuna, mudita, upekkha
cultural_context.significance: Considered essential preparation for insight meditation and liberation
